hackathon-description-text: Startup Weekend; Techfugees France partner together to bring developers, designers, entrepreneurs and community members to develop creative tech solutions with; for refugees living in France.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of Market Growth France, Paypal

hackathon-rules:
- Your tech solution needs to come from a real need
- You can show evidence that the project has been built with your user in mind, better if co-built with your user
- you are using low-tech: one that needs really little complexity and infrastructure

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Techfugees thanks to its Platinium Sponsor, Paypal, offers support for the next 3 months via a desk space at LLL, mentorship from Paypal & Techfugees and a 100 000 EUR worth of transaction via paypal free of fees.
Round trip to Greece to work on the prototype and test the technology with the team behind the Elpida camp.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the solution tackle a challenge that was presented on Friday and there is a real work done as a team on it?
Have you researched the problem and made steps towards verifying that this the real problem? Explain to us how you framed the problem.
Is the project viable ($) and scalable? Talk about the business model, and what scalability you are thinking for it.
Have you worked with refugees to build your prototype and idea? Show us that your solution has a real impact on refugees.
Is it innovative (not just new and unheard of: it adds value) and feasible (does it sound realistically possible to be built?) Demonstrate it is better that what already is.

hackathon-description-header: A weekend working on tech solutions with and for refugees living in Paris
